content.description:
Formulas and properties of some group 1 and 2 compounds are listed in the table.

Compound
 Molar Mass
 <math alttext="K sub s p" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mi>K</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>s</mi> <mi>p</mi> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>
 Appearance

<math alttext="N a O H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaOH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="40. grams per mole" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>40.</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g/mol</mtext></mrow></math>
 <math alttext="1.1 times 10 to the exponent of 2" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>1.1</mn> <mo>×</mo> <msup> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>
 White, flaky powder

<math alttext="K O H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>KOH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="56 grams per mole" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>56</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g/mol</mtext></mrow></math>
 <math alttext="3.6 times 10 to the exponent of 2" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>3.6</mn> <mo>×</mo> <msup> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>
 White powder

<math alttext="M g, open parenthesis, O H, close parenthesis, 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Mg(OH)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="58 grams per mole" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>58</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g/mol</mtext></mrow></math>
 <math alttext="1.8 times 10 to the exponent of negative 11" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>1.8</mn> <mo>×</mo> <msup> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>11</mn> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>
 White powder

<math alttext="C a open parenthesis, O H, close parenthesis 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Ca(OH)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="74 grams per mole" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>74</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g/mol</mtext></mrow></math>
 <math alttext="5.5 times 10 to the exponent of negative 6 " overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>5.5</mn> <mo>×</mo> <msup> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>6</mn> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>
 White, flaky powder
content.question: Which of the following questions could be tested to determine if an unknown white powder was a hydroxide from group 2 and not from group 1?

choices.label: Does the compound conduct electricity when dissolved in distilled water?
Does the compound dissolve significantly in distilled water?

Does the compound form a precipitate when reacted with <math alttext="H N O 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>HNO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

Does the compound have a molar mass above <math alttext="50 grams per mole" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>50</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g/mol</mtext></mrow></math>?

content.answer: Does the compound dissolve significantly in distilled water?

skill.text: 2.A: Identify a testable scientific question based on an observation, data, or a model.
